hints.content:
Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:
$3$ | $7$ | $\blueD1$ | $4$ | $0$

The $\blueD1$ in $37{,}\blueD140$ is in  the $\blueD{\text{hundreds}}$ place.

Now, let's divide $37{,}\blueD140\div10$. 


Dividing by $10$ moves every digit one place to the right.

Hundred thousands | Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:
|$\rightarrow\fbox3$ | $\fbox7$ |$\blueD{\fbox1}$ | $\fbox4$ | $\fbox0$

$37{,}\blueD140\div 10=37\blueD14$

Hundred thousands | Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:
$$ | $$ | $3$ | $7$ | $\blueD1$ | $4$

The $\blueD1$ moves to the $\blueD{\text{tens}}$ place.

question.content:
Divide.

$37{,}140\div10$

**What will be the place value of the $1$ after we divide?**
